Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE
Name: Jug
Description: Globular jug, with a wide mouth, an outward turning rim, which is triangular in cross-section, curved walls and a foot  set off by means of an edging. The surface has a reddish coating with inclusions of gypsum and mica. On the upper third of the body are four small semicircular handles above which a line appears, made by the potter's wheel and running  longitudinally.
